Posts.Content: May 24, 2010 06:03PM celtic wrote: Hi Lilly ; I understand your fear of not being taken seriously. You ARE doing the right thing, get a doctor to take you seriously.. I dont know where you are but since you have insurance call a" Breast Surgeon " in your city and get seen. The surgeon is the best person to feel it and if need be do a biopsy . It may be just an ingrown hair that is infected which does swell with fluid and drain so the lump does down.... but you want to know. keep us updated, best to you. Christine
Posts.Title: very worried and not being taken seriously :( Lilly12345678 Jenene

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2010 11:45AM celtic wrote: Hi Honeybear;  I had to respond, my husband is a dentist in his own practice and also oversees the dental clinic at a major hospital.. with that said you can certainly find out if your hospitals have a dental clinic. Call them and get an appointment, the treatment is first quality at a fraction of the price and they also accept insurance if you should have any. They will also be able to advise and monitor any medications that you are on or need to take for the dental procedures. The peace of mind part,  is that you are at the hospital  and they have access to all meds and doctors :o) Good luck and remember you have to treat you well. It's about loving ourselves and putting us first finally. (((((  hugs )))) Christine

Posts.Content: May 9, 2010 07:03PM celtic wrote: Hi Sproutdr; I get one MRI and Mammagram once a year for the past four years, the best way I handle MRI's is to have as LITTLE sleep the night before so I am exhausted the morning or afternoon of the test.. it works well since it makes me sleep or just doze off not caring about the noise or the technician telling me how many more to go. Hope this helps.... of course make sure they put on the fan and you get ear plugs. Will be thinking of you in June.

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2010 05:14PM - edited Feb 18, 2010 05:15PM by celtic I am sorry that you are going through this, my tumor was just under 5cm and I did 4 sessions of AC , then surgery and followed up with 4 sessions of Taxol. By the time I had the third treatment of AC we did MRI's and saw that the tumor had shrunk by 33 to 50 % !! I was excited since it makes for a clear margin when surgery is done. We did the fourth round of AC and then scheduled surgery. My best to you.**  I was able to feel that the tumor was getting smaller.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed in January bcfighter Twinmom77

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2010 12:35AM celtic wrote: I am about 4 years out of left side mastc. with 10 lymph nodes removed on my left side. I have had that terrible painful pulling under my arm pit for the last few years and have been worried that the cancer was still there or had spread. It also started on the right side but not as bad  ( had reduction on the right side breast ) My breast surgeon finally did surgery last November to do a bioposy and it was scar tissue that had been creating the pain... best remedy has been pilates !!! it has help my pain and I no longer have that pulling and tightening feeling that makes you cringe. I was not sure that I could handle the movements and length of upper body exercises, but I was able to use the modified versions when needed. Hope this helps... if you can't join a group, just get a DVD.
